poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: If I blew my nose my gran would say 'You'll blaw your brains to train ile!' which I thought must be somewhere between Lough Derg and Innisfree. But no. Ile was oil and train Not diesel but, as Olson told me, blubber. Blubber, eh? Like your mother-in-law As her son goes down the aisle.
